newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romanian leu nudges down to 3,155/65 to dlr.
newsitem.headline: Romanian leu nudges down to 3,155/65 to dlr.

text.p: The Romanian leu drifted lower on Friday to 3,155/65 to the dollar after having stuck at 3,150/60 over the past week in slack interbank trading.
Traders said the leu's small slide would not impress hard currency owners who are looking for a dollar much more fattened for sale before they will join the market.
"I have fewer and fewer sellers. The ratio between dollar sellers and buyers is one to four," said a frustrated trader with one of the four market-making dealer banks.

"I'm struggling to convince exporters to deal on other currencies as prices are better. But they are still reluctant, selling only when they have to settle outstanding payments," said a trader with a broker bank.
The German mark or French franc, quoted up to 2,181/48 lei and 642/74 lei, give at cross weaker leu-dollar prices of around 3,400.
Operators said they expect renewed pressure on the battered leu currency in September when activity will intensify after the summer torpor.
"The signs are very clear on the retail market where leu- dollar prices have started a pre-autumn downswing," said another trader with a broker bank.
At licensed money changing bureaux the leu has weakened to some 3,500 to the dollar after loitering near 3,450 over the past days.
Money market dealers said short-term rates closed the week marking time at 47-48 percent.

"Even with the end-month factor one-week rates are unlikely to touch 49 percent," said one trader, adding that most banks have already fulfilled their minimum reserve targets. -- Mirela Eremia, Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
